description: Word 2016 Expert takes users to the next level in document processing.  This series explores how to enhance long documents with episodes that include: creating a table of contents, generating an index, adding footnotes and endnotes, inserting bookmarks and cross references, labeling figures with captions, and citing references for a bibliography. Also covered in long documents is how to create a master document and add sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and add or edit document properties. While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or enjoyed in sequence.

Also covered in long documents is how to create a master document and add sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and add or edit document properties. While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or enjoyed in sequence.
name: Word 2016 Expert
subtitle: Document and word processing software

episodes.description: Word 2016 Expert takes users to the next level in document processing.  This series explores how to enhance long documents with episodes that include: creating a table of contents, generating an index, adding footnotes and endnotes, inserting bookmarks and cross references, labeling figures with captions, and citing references for a bibliography. Also covered in long documents is how to create a master document and add sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and add or edit document properties. While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or enjoyed in sequence.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:06.300
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:06.300 --> 00:00:09.176
Hello everyone, and
welcome to Office Pro TV.

3
00:00:09.176 --> 00:00:12.681
My name is Von Smith, and
in this course overview,

4
00:00:12.681 --> 00:00:18.320
we're going to be reviewing what we
are doing in our Word 2016 Expert Series.

5
00:00:18.320 --> 00:00:21.986
So we're gonna be talking about,
well, what are we gonna be talking

6
00:00:21.986 --> 00:00:25.670
about in this series, and
what episodes are we going to be covering?

7
00:00:25.670 --> 00:00:29.703
Who is our target audience, what should
you know before you get started?

8
00:00:29.703 --> 00:00:34.289
And any other extra information and
tidbits that I have for you.

9
00:00:34.289 --> 00:00:39.470
So topics to be covered,
some of my favorites in all of Word.

10
00:00:39.470 --> 00:00:41.419
Well, actually a lot of
them are my favorites,

11
00:00:41.419 --> 00:00:43.830
I think I said that about every
single one of these things.

12
00:00:43.830 --> 00:00:50.184
But long document creation, you have maybe
more than 100 pages, maybe 50 pages.

13
00:00:50.184 --> 00:00:54.162
So, there are things you can do with
creating a long document, if you really,

14
00:00:54.162 --> 00:00:56.770
really help,
that Word is really good at it.

15
00:00:56.770 --> 00:00:59.935
So, we're gonna be talking about
bookmarks and cross-references.

16
00:00:59.935 --> 00:01:04.582
The things you see in your page that says,
see page so on and so forth.

17
00:01:04.582 --> 00:01:08.166
[LAUGH] Well, you could go ahead and
add that right from within Word with

18
00:01:08.166 --> 00:01:11.525
a cross-reference, and
create hyperlinks, super powerful.

19
00:01:11.525 --> 00:01:15.015
We also are going to be generating
a table of contents, and

20
00:01:15.015 --> 00:01:18.090
then an index that goes in the front and
back of your book.

21
00:01:18.090 --> 00:01:22.380
Table of Contents, really handy and really
easy, just gotta use those styles and

22
00:01:22.380 --> 00:01:24.110
use those heading levels.

23
00:01:24.110 --> 00:01:27.350
And the index is just as easy,
with just a little bit more work

24
00:01:27.350 --> 00:01:30.530
with marking up your entries and
generating that index.

25
00:01:30.530 --> 00:01:34.160
The nice thing is, all of these things,
when you start modifying, you can update

26
00:01:34.160 --> 00:01:39.490
them really easily, by just updating
the fields from this generated content.

27
00:01:39.490 --> 00:01:41.970
We'll also be adding footnotes and
endnotes,

28
00:01:41.970 --> 00:01:46.040
those things that I used to struggle
with when I was writing term papers.

29
00:01:46.040 --> 00:01:50.145
And those different things in school where
you had to get the numbers just right.

30
00:01:50.145 --> 00:01:52.820
Word it makes it so much easier, and

31
00:01:52.820 --> 00:01:58.690
then on that same note, generating
a bibliography and citing your works.

32
00:01:58.690 --> 00:02:01.600
Man, when this came into Word,
it was of those,

33
00:02:01.600 --> 00:02:05.920
I really wished they had this when I was
in high school and writing these papers.

34
00:02:05.920 --> 00:02:09.376
It would take those nights
that I spent all night crying,

35
00:02:09.376 --> 00:02:13.192
because I couldn't get the typewriter or
whatever to work, or

36
00:02:13.192 --> 00:02:16.166
maybe even if it's writing on pen and
paper.

37
00:02:16.166 --> 00:02:18.281
Goodness gracious, that was a lot of fun.

38
00:02:18.281 --> 00:02:21.896
We're also gonna be talking
about master documents, and

39
00:02:21.896 --> 00:02:26.027
how you can create one big document
with little subdocuments, and

40
00:02:26.027 --> 00:02:30.619
how they're all connected, so
it's a really powerful episode as well.

41
00:02:30.619 --> 00:02:33.702
Collaborating, something I
love to do with people, so

42
00:02:33.702 --> 00:02:37.977
if you work with multiple people on
revisions and editing of your documents.

43
00:02:37.977 --> 00:02:42.420
How to implement tracked changes is
going to be really helpful for you.

44
00:02:42.420 --> 00:02:45.680
How to combine all of those
tracked changes together, and

45
00:02:45.680 --> 00:02:47.100
to be able to accept or

46
00:02:47.100 --> 00:02:52.290
reject some of those changes that people
have made will also be part of that.

47
00:02:52.290 --> 00:02:55.450
We're gonna be talking about adding
comments into your documents, and

48
00:02:55.450 --> 00:02:58.770
how you can use those and
how to accept or reject, or

49
00:02:58.770 --> 00:03:03.740
talk within those comments back and
forth with your collaborators.

50
00:03:03.740 --> 00:03:07.880
We'll also be discussing how you
can collaborate in real time online

51
00:03:09.010 --> 00:03:12.075
through Office 365,
if you have have that capability, and

52
00:03:12.075 --> 00:03:14.305
you have an Office 365 subscription.

53
00:03:14.305 --> 00:03:19.365
And they've really come a long way in
how you can collaborate in the cloud

54
00:03:19.365 --> 00:03:22.045
to where it's a really, really helpful and

55
00:03:22.045 --> 00:03:27.855
efficient way to talk to your different
people in where you are working with.

56
00:03:27.855 --> 00:03:32.125
Security and document properties, another
area that's really great to know about.

57
00:03:32.125 --> 00:03:35.830
Of all that hidden information
into your documents,

58
00:03:35.830 --> 00:03:39.390
in the document properties, that metadata,
and how we can use that efficiently.

59
00:03:39.390 --> 00:03:44.930
And then document security,
how do I make this a true read only file?

60
00:03:44.930 --> 00:03:47.486
How do I allow people to
only fill in forms and

61
00:03:47.486 --> 00:03:50.183
other different types
of document security,

62
00:03:50.183 --> 00:03:55.040
with adding digital signatures and adding
passwords, to protect that document?

63
00:03:55.040 --> 00:03:57.467
And then we'll also throw
in some additional topics,

64
00:03:57.467 --> 00:03:59.180
that's where I put in the forms.

65
00:03:59.180 --> 00:04:02.390
Something that Word can do,
it's actually pretty simple

66
00:04:02.390 --> 00:04:06.020
once you know where you can actually find
the form fields in that developer tab.

67
00:04:06.020 --> 00:04:09.910
And a few of the other additional topics
that we'll be adding throughout time.

68
00:04:11.490 --> 00:04:15.860
Who is this product, what is this
show meant for, who is this for?

69
00:04:15.860 --> 00:04:20.215
We have all Office users, now,
I have Office in capital letter because it

70
00:04:20.215 --> 00:04:24.162
doesn't mean that you're physically
in an office environment.

71
00:04:24.162 --> 00:04:28.919
You could be an office of one,
you could be a school or university, so

72
00:04:28.919 --> 00:04:34.678
it's office with a capital, as in the
products, you are using Microsoft Office.

73
00:04:34.678 --> 00:04:39.670
And Word, of course, is its flagship
product that many people use.

74
00:04:39.670 --> 00:04:45.310
And I've thrown this,
intermediate to advanced Word users.

75
00:04:45.310 --> 00:04:50.126
So you will need to have a pretty
substantial amount of information or

76
00:04:50.126 --> 00:04:51.795
knowledge about Word.

77
00:04:51.795 --> 00:04:55.110
Now I've changed this from foundational,

78
00:04:55.110 --> 00:04:59.600
when we did our advanced overview,
I went to substantial.

79
00:04:59.600 --> 00:05:04.000
So, you need to be comfortable
within Word, pretty comfortable,

80
00:05:04.000 --> 00:05:06.570
to when you know all about styles.

81
00:05:06.570 --> 00:05:08.770
You know about sections and
page layouts, and

82
00:05:08.770 --> 00:05:10.660
you know where everything
is on the ribbon.

83
00:05:10.660 --> 00:05:14.240
So, some of those things I
might start glossing over,

84
00:05:14.240 --> 00:05:17.240
like selecting ranges of text.

85
00:05:17.240 --> 00:05:20.328
It should be, yeah, I know how to do that,
I know what a style is,

86
00:05:20.328 --> 00:05:21.370
I know how to modify it.

87
00:05:21.370 --> 00:05:27.220
I know what you're talking about when I
go into the modify styles dialog box,

88
00:05:27.220 --> 00:05:30.820
so that's why I threw
this up to a substantial.

89
00:05:30.820 --> 00:05:34.365
And of course, the Windows operating
system, you do need to know how to

90
00:05:34.365 --> 00:05:38.700
work within Windows, and get to your File
Explorer, and different things like that.

91
00:05:38.700 --> 00:05:43.128
And, of course, always having familiarity
with other Office products is always

92
00:05:43.128 --> 00:05:46.401
helpful, because the options
are always in the same place,

93
00:05:46.401 --> 00:05:48.541
no matter you're using Word or Excel.

94
00:05:48.541 --> 00:05:51.628
So you're familiar with that and
you know where your ribbons are and

95
00:05:51.628 --> 00:05:53.870
you're familiar with that interface.

96
00:05:53.870 --> 00:05:56.210
Each product does something different, but

97
00:05:56.210 --> 00:06:00.360
some of those features will overlap
from one product to another.

98
00:06:00.360 --> 00:06:06.242
And then my extras, there's always going
to be other options on how to do things.

99
00:06:06.242 --> 00:06:09.634
I can already tell you I remember
in the footnotes episode that I

100
00:06:09.634 --> 00:06:13.987
was showing you a little button up on the
ribbon of how you can jump back and forth.

101
00:06:13.987 --> 00:06:18.360
Well, you could also right click on it,
and I actually just didn't show it to

102
00:06:18.360 --> 00:06:21.479
you that way,
I just decided to go through the ribbon.

103
00:06:21.479 --> 00:06:23.586
So there's always that right clicking or

104
00:06:23.586 --> 00:06:27.211
there's the same button on another
tab that maybe I haven't covered.

105
00:06:27.211 --> 00:06:32.459
So there's always gonna to be multiple
ways to accomplish the same thing.

106
00:06:32.459 --> 00:06:36.070
Updates happen, we talk about this
a lot throughout our episodes.

107
00:06:37.100 --> 00:06:41.309
These products, if you're on an Office
365 subscription, they do update.

108
00:06:41.309 --> 00:06:45.648
And if you're on the cycle that updates
every month or every four months, you

109
00:06:45.648 --> 00:06:50.188
might see things differently now in your
Office environment than the time of this

110
00:06:50.188 --> 00:06:55.760
recording, of where my Office environment
might have been on a different update.

111
00:06:55.760 --> 00:06:59.459
So just know that that will happen, and
a lot of times, your updates are for

112
00:06:59.459 --> 00:07:02.648
the better, and it adds new features,
which can be really fun.

113
00:07:02.648 --> 00:07:06.880
Searching for answers, using the oracle,
the oracle as in the internet, and

114
00:07:06.880 --> 00:07:09.333
you go out there and
search for your answers.

115
00:07:09.333 --> 00:07:13.283
There are so many different things that
you can learn about Word that we can't

116
00:07:13.283 --> 00:07:14.820
cover all in these episodes.

117
00:07:14.820 --> 00:07:18.290
I try give you as much as possible, and
things that I feel are really helpful and

118
00:07:18.290 --> 00:07:18.877
important.

119
00:07:18.877 --> 00:07:23.685
But you're gonna run into things that are
kind of weird sometimes, and you need to

120
00:07:23.685 --> 00:07:28.710
know how to fix it, so consulting the
oracle is going to be really important.

121
00:07:28.710 --> 00:07:32.614
And everybody uses Word differently, so
if we're covering a topic where it's like,

122
00:07:32.614 --> 00:07:34.913
I'm never gonna need to
generate a bibliography,

123
00:07:34.913 --> 00:07:36.638
because I don't need to cite my work.

124
00:07:36.638 --> 00:07:41.511
That's fine, but you never know when
your child, or maybe you niece or

125
00:07:41.511 --> 00:07:46.242
nephew, or maybe just a friend,
is going to be writing a term paper.

126
00:07:46.242 --> 00:07:48.770
And they need to cite their work,
and you're like, hey, I know how you

127
00:07:48.770 --> 00:07:51.620
can actually generate a bibliography,
and you can pass along that knowledge.

128
00:07:51.620 --> 00:07:56.300
So just knowing that it can do it
can be really helpful for you, or

129
00:07:56.300 --> 00:07:58.150
somebody else down the line.

130
00:07:58.150 --> 00:08:02.258
And of course, having fun,
I like to have fun in these episodes.

131
00:08:02.258 --> 00:08:05.222
I actually try to keep it light and
keep it cheery so

132
00:08:05.222 --> 00:08:08.412
when we're learning about this,
it is fun to learn.

133
00:08:08.412 --> 00:08:13.353
And I hope you will enjoy it, and
that way, once you learn it, it'll make

134
00:08:13.353 --> 00:08:18.394
it to you can have more fun using Word,
cuz you'll know how to work with it.

135
00:08:18.394 --> 00:08:22.052
So I look forward to seeing you soon,
and stay around.

136
00:08:22.052 --> 00:08:26.998
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate and explain using bookmarks and cross references. Here they show you bookmark specifics like marking a location, naming conventions, and selecting a range of content. Then they look at cross reference specifics like using hyperlinks and choosing what text to display as the cross reference.
episodes.title: Bookmarks and Cross References

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to insert a table of contents (TOC) into your Word documents. Here they will go over heading levels (styles), TOC templates, map to custom styles for TOC, updating TOC, and removing TOC.
episodes.title: Table of Contents

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel show how to manually mark words and ranges to be included in an index and then how generate the index. They also cover how to auto mark entries from a concordance file, how to update and format an index, and how to remove marked entries.
episodes.title: Create Index

episodes.description: Citing work for use in research or academic papers is very important. In this episode, Vonne and Zach show you how easy Word has made it to add and manage sources, insert citations, and generate and update a bibliography.
episodes.title: Citations and Bibliography

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Vonne discuss footnotes and endnotes. They cover how to add, format, update, delete, and convert footnotes and/or endnotes in a Word document.
episodes.title: Footnotes and Endnotes

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Zach demonstrate adding captions to graphical elements. They cover how to create custom labels, how to insert or delete captions that should automatically update (and how to force them to update when it doesn’t auto update), and ultimately generate a table of figures.
episodes.title: Captions and Table of Figures

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach demonstrate how to create a master document and use the Outlining tab on the Ribbon. They show how to add, collapse and expand, and unlink subdocuments. They also discuss the importance of using consistent headings.
episodes.title: Master Document

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to track changes made to documents in Word 2016. Here you will specifically learn how to enable/disable tracking, add comments, make changes, and how to modify display preferences. They demonstrate how to review tracked changes by accepting or rejecting changes as well as deleting comments. They also show how to lock tracking so collaborators cannot turn them off.
episodes.title: Track Changes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at two separate, yet related functions – compare documents and combine documents. First, they explore using compare documents which allows you to merge two documents together and Word highlights the differences. Next, they show you how to combine tracked edits from multiple documents into a single document.
episodes.title: Compare and Combine Documents

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to collaborate with others to make edits in your documents using OneDrive and other Office 365 account features. They will explain how to invite collaborators, chat in real time, and remove sharing in OneDrive when necessary. They demonstrate using both locally installed Word and Word Online.
episodes.title: Collaborate Online

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne go over some important security features found in Word 2016. Specific features you'll see here includes, hidden text, restrict editing, and adding password protection to a document.
episodes.title: Document Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue looking at security features found in Word 2016. They round out the topic by showing you how to restrict access to documents as well as covering the basics of working with digital signatures.
episodes.title: Document Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue looking at security features in Word 2016. Here they finish by looking at a few more details with regards to editing restrictions.
episodes.title: Document Security Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate working with document properties which will help make a document more searchable as well as adding more usable information to a document. This is also known as metadata. They also discuss important features such as inspect a document, check accessibility, and check compatibility.
episodes.title: Document Properties

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the exciting world of Forms in Word 2016. Here they will show you how to create a re-usable, custom form that will enable you to have fillable fields, checkboxes, and dynamic tables.
episodes.title: Forms

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to customize the Word User Interface(UI) to suit your personal tastes. Specific customizations covered here includes: customizing the Ribbon, custom keyboard shortcuts, editing options, printing options, and more.
episodes.title: Customize Interface
